memberdef.name: list_foreach_entry
memberdef.initializer: for (t = l, e = (type)list_car(t); \ ! list_is_empty(t); \ t = list_cdr(t), e = (type)list_car(t))

detaileddescription.para: standardization:
a list ends with a cell that looks like:

it should look like this:
but this doesnt work, because we would need to be able to modify the pointers but of course they are passed by value...

simplesect.para: A newly allocated list, or NULL on failure

detaileddescription.para: inverse of list_create() does not free contents
list_atom_destroy() chained together across an entire list. currently recursive, so probs not a good function for large lists... although i heard GCC can optimize tail recursion, so this may be fine
like list_destroy() but calls free on each car.

Sets the car of a list.

list.
v
the value.

Sets the cdr of a list.
l
list.
v
the value.

simplesect.para: true if the parameter is empty
a list formed of the given value cons-ed with the given list. Allocates memory. Returns NULL on failure.

detaileddescription.para:
Maps a function across all elements of a list
a new list of the results, or NULL on failure

Given a filtering function,
l
The list to filter.
fn
A function to apply to each element in the list. If the application is TRUE, then the element is retained, else it is not included in the new list.
args
Arguments to be passed to the filtering function.
a new list consisting of elements of the old list that pass the test or NULL on failure.

destructively modifies the current list. note, you must assign the result back in place, for this method is unable to modify in place, at the current time.
the list reversed. pointer to new head.

Destructive.
l
A list.
v
A value to insert at the last position.
The last element of the list now points to a new node containing v.
The newly created end node, or NULL on failure.

Removes the element at the given index
the value of the element removed, or NULL on failure.
the following 3 functions conform to the function signatures accepted by list_map and list_filter

simplesect.para: a new empty list, or NULL on failure.

detaileddescription.para:
Alias of: l = list_cons(v, l);
l
A list to become the cdr.
v
A value to become the car.
A list composed of v and l or NULL on failure

Destructive. Convenience function. Opposite of list_push().
l
A list.
The car of the old list.
The list is now the cdr of the original list.

simplesect.para: the value at the nth position of the list. NULL on failure, however accessing past the end of the list is undefined.

a new array, filled with the contents of the provided list the list is NULL terminated, but since the values of the array may be NULL, this should not be used to determine the length of the array. rather, list_size() should be used. NULL on failure or empty list.
index of first eleemnt encountered matching needle, ENOTFND otherwise.
index of first eleemnt encountered matching needle, ENOTFND otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Willi Ballenthin This file contains the declaration of a singly-linked list data structure.
